question.title: UTF-8 Encoding Error when Running External Groovy Script from Grails

node.contents: are you running this application from NetBeans IDE? else can you run it froom NetBeans IDE.NetBeans latest version support Grails and Groovy

node.contents: I am trying to call an external Groovy script from within a Grails application. I have the following code:

astNode.text: I am trying to call an external Groovy script from within a Grails application. I have the following code:

elements.contents: def initialSize = 4096 def outStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream(initialSize) def errStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream(initialSize) def process ="groovy -cp src/groovy/ src/groovy/externalscript.groovy ".execute() process.consumeProcessOutput(outStream, errStream) process.waitFor() println 'out:\n' + outStream println 'err:\n' + errStream println process.exitValue()

units.rawText: def initialSize = 4096 def outStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream(initialSize) def errStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream(initialSize) def process ="groovy -cp src/groovy/ src/groovy/externalscript.groovy ".execute() processconsumeProcessOutput(outStream, errStream) processwaitFor() println 'out:\n' + outStream println 'err:\n' + errStream println processexitValue()

node.contents: Error occurred during initialization of VM java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException: "UTF-8" at java.nio.charset.Charset.checkName(Charset.java:284) at java.nio.charset.Charset.lookup2(Charset.java:458) at java.nio.charset.Charset.lookup(Charset.java:437) at java.nio.charset.Charset.defaultCharset(Charset.java:579) at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.forOutputStreamWriter(StreamEncoder.java:37) at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.(OutputStreamWriter.java:94) at java.io.PrintStream.(PrintStream.java:100) at java.lang.System.initializeSystemClass(System.java:1092)

node.contents: The script works fine outside of Grails and I am not sure where the encoding issue is coming from. I have tried saving the externalscript.groovy as UTF-8 but I run into the same issue.

astNode.text: The script works fine outside of Grails and I am not sure where the encoding issue is coming from. I have tried saving the externalscript.groovy as UTF-8 but I run into the same issue.

node.contents: What if you change your output streams to:

astNode.text: What if you change your output streams to:

elements.contents: def outStream = new StringWriter(initialSize) def errStream = new StringWriter(initialSize)

units.rawText: def outStream = new StringWriter(initialSize) def errStream = new StringWriter(initialSize)

node.contents: THANK YOU, Michael! That just saved our day at the office, trying to figure out why Glassfish refused to accept UTF-8. -Dfile.encoding="UTF-8" worked in the shell (since the shell removes the quotes), but not in the GF config. I finally replicated the error after reading your answer by setting -Dfile.encoding=\"UTF-8\" in the shell. Simply removing the quotes solved the case.

astNode.text: THANK YOU, Michael! That just saved our day at the office, trying to figure out why Glassfish refused to accept UTF-8. -Dfile.encoding="UTF-8" worked in the shell (since the shell removes the quotes), but not in the GF config. I finally replicated the error after reading your answer by setting -Dfile.encoding=\"UTF-8\" in the shell. Simply removing the quotes solved the case.

node.contents: The exception is thrown because the plateform default encoding for the child JVM somehow ended up being "UTF-8" including the quotation marks, which is not a legal charset name. It has nothing to do with the script itself, but with the way Grails spawns the child JVM.

astNode.text: The exception is thrown because the plateform default encoding for the child JVM somehow ended up being "UTF-8" including the quotation marks, which is not a legal charset name. It has nothing to do with the script itself, but with the way Grails spawns the child JVM.

node.contents: anywhere in your Grails configuration? Or code that sets the file.encoding system property?

astNode.text: anywhere in your Grails configuration? Or code that sets the file.encoding system property?
